results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone

results.title: Making 'The Girl from Tomorrow'
results.brief_description: The making of “The Girl from Tomorrow” provides teachers of media with an example of how this exciting series was made. Interviews with the director, Kathy Mueller and the producer, Noel Price are included along with technical information on just how the special effects were achieved.

results.title: Scouts: the rise of the world scouting movement
results.creator_credit: Michael Dana Murphy and Clear Horizon Films
results.brief_description: Scouts is a celebration of the potential of youth that documents the triumphs and tragedies of the Scout ideal. Historic newsreels, rare archival film and scenes from Baden-Powell’s own home movies bring alive the era of Baden-Powell and the origins of Scouting. “Scouts” is a unique program that will captivate any audience, whether or not they have taken the Scout oath.

results.title: La Ronde
results.brief_description: An ironic narrator comperes Ophuls’ circular tale of love and seduction set in the nostalgic Vienna of 1900. “La Ronde” was booed at its premiere, but went on to become one of the greatest successes of post-war European cinema. Bans and protests againsts its ‘immorality’ only boosted its fame: in London it played for eighteen months at one cinema. With a superb cast, lavish production values and bravura camerawork, “La Ronde” confirms Ophuls’ reputation as one of the cinema’s major artists. Stars a veritable who’s who of European cinema including Anton Walbrook, Simone Signoret, Serge Reggiani, Simone Simon, Daniel Gelin, Danielle Darrieux, Fernand Gravey, Odette Joyeux, Jean-Louis Barrault, Isa Miranda and Gerard Philipe.

results.title: How to Successfully Manage Your Time
results.brief_description: Practical examples of time management for office workers and business people make this instructional program most useful. It shows the effective time management techniques “How to spend your time”, “How to organise your time”, “How to eliminate time wasters”.

results.title: The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Gary Mehlman, Walter Moshay and Columbia
results.brief_description: Based on the classic books by Astrid Lindgren, Pippi Longstocking bursts onto the screen in this all new live action motion picture. Loved the world over by young and old, Pippi Longstocking is a pigtailed, freckle faced ball of fun and energy. Mischievous, lovable and always in trouble, Pippi is a young orphan who refuses to let anything stand in her way. Full of colourful characters, fun and laughs “The new adventures of Pippi Longstocking” is a delightful adventure movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: Play School. Hats
results.brief_description: In these five episodes of Play School, John Hamblin and Noni Hazelhurst have lots of fun with all kinds of hats. They make hats, they wear hats and they tell stories and sing about the people who wear them. Songs include “Do you put your hat on your head?”, “Three little fishes”, “Wiggerly Woo”, “Hey diddle diddle” and others. Some of the delightful stories are Mrs. Honey’s Hat, Jonathan Just and the Quangle Wangle’s Hat. In all, two and a half hours of wonderful entertainment for children.

results.title: Time Zones
results.creator_credit: Derek Jarman, James MacKay and Dark Pictures
results.brief_description: Sloane Square: A Room of One’s Own (1976, 9min); This super 8 footage shot in 1976 features Jarman and friends and is an example of his more personal, quasi-diary work. “Pirate Tape” (1982, 15 min); A portrait of William Burroughs, filmed during his visit to London in September 1982 for the Final Academy event. “TG Psychic Rally in Heaven” Film of “Throbbing Gristle” in concert, on 23/12/80, accompanied by three tracks from their “2nd Annual Report” album. Experiments with super-imposition and refilming abstract the performance into coloured patterns, drawing attention to the sound track content.

results.title: The Man with the movie camera = Chelovek s kinoapparatom
results.brief_description: Writer/Director/Editor, Dziga-Vertov, was made Head of the Cinema Department of the All Russian Central Executive at the age of 22. His film shows all the tricks of which the camera is capable. Vertov shows Russia as it really is; indeed, the final impact of the film arises from a feeling of participation in life itself as we share the unique vision of the camera-eye.

results.title: Overcoming Neck and Back Pain
results.creator_credit: G Roberts, Garry Egger and Centre for Health Promotion and Research
results.brief_description: Produced by a panel of back care experts in co-operation with the Royal Australian College of GP’s, this video is designed to provide information about back pain as well as a comprehensive exercise routine for dealing with and preventing back pain. Section 1: Basic back structure; Section 2: Day to day back care Section 3: Exercise routine.
